intro: Asketanthera ekmaniana, commonly known as the African firethorn, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, spiny foliage and bright red bracts that surround its small white flowers. The plant is adapted to nutrient-poor soils and is often found in rocky or coastal habitats. Its unique appearance makes it a popular ornamental plant, though it can be invasive in certain regions. The species is also valued for its ecological role in supporting local insect and bird populations.
